## News Review for docusign

# DocuSign News Review

## Executive Summary

DocuSign faces a mixed period of operational challenges and strategic positioning as the company prepares to report quarterly earnings on December 5th amid broader market scrutiny of AI investment returns in enterprise software. The company successfully defended against a supply chain security attack through Gainsight's Salesforce integration, with Chief Information Security Officer Michael Adams confirming no data compromise after comprehensive investigation and proactively terminating all Gainsight integrations as a precautionary measure ([TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2025/11/21/google-says-hackers-stole-data-from-200-companies-following-gainsight-breach/)). Meanwhile, DocuSign continues advancing its AI capabilities through strategic partnerships, leveraging Microsoft Azure AI and Elastic's search platform to deliver generative AI-powered document processing to customers worldwide, as highlighted in Elastic's Microsoft Partner of the Year announcement ([Elastic Blog](https://www.elastic.co/blog/elastic-wins-2025-microsoft-latam-partner-of-the-year)).

## Key Developments

**Financial Performance**: DocuSign is scheduled to report quarterly earnings on December 5th, with results expected to provide insight into the company's performance amid broader market concerns about AI investment sustainability in enterprise software ([Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/stocks-drift-back-toward-record-highs-as-the-final-month-of-2025-gets-underway-what-to-watch-this-week-122743521.html), [SiliconANGLE](https://siliconangle.com/2025/11/28/uh-oh-accounting-concerns-circle-ai-boom/)).

**Security Response**: The company successfully contained a potential security breach stemming from the Gainsight-Salesforce supply chain attack, terminating all Gainsight integrations and containing related data flows despite finding no evidence of actual data compromise ([TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2025/11/21/google-says-hackers-stole-data-from-200-companies-following-gainsight-breach/)).

**Product Enhancement**: DocuSign has integrated generative AI capabilities through partnerships with Microsoft Azure AI and Elastic's search platform, enabling enhanced document processing functionalities for its global customer base ([Elastic Blog](https://www.elastic.co/blog/elastic-wins-2025-microsoft-latam-partner-of-the-year)).

## Market Context

DocuSign's developments occur within a challenging enterprise software environment where companies face increased scrutiny over AI investment returns and supply chain security vulnerabilities. The company's partnership-based approach to AI integration positions it alongside other enterprise software providers adopting external AI technologies rather than developing proprietary solutions. The security incident highlights growing risks associated with third-party SaaS integrations across the industry, potentially creating competitive advantages for vendors with fewer external dependencies.

## Notable Quotes

**Michael Adams, Chief Information Security Officer at DocuSign**: "Following a comprehensive log analysis and internal investigation, we have no indication of Docusign data compromise at this time" and "out of an abundance of caution, we have taken a number of measures including terminating all Gainsight integrations and containing related data flows" - responding to the Gainsight security incident ([TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2025/11/21/google-says-hackers-stole-data-from-200-companies-following-gainsight-breach/)).

**Hiral Shah, Director of Product at DocuSign**: "We can deliver powerful AI capabilities from our partnerships with Microsoft Azure AI with Elastic's robust search functionalities" - discussing the company's AI integration strategy ([Elastic Blog](https://www.elastic.co/blog/elastic-wins-2025-microsoft-latam-partner-of-the-year)).

## Strategic Implications

DocuSign's response to the security incident demonstrates strong operational security capabilities and transparency, potentially strengthening customer trust despite the initial threat exposure. The company's partnership-based AI strategy provides faster time-to-market for advanced capabilities but creates dependencies on external providers like Microsoft and Elastic. As AI agents increasingly automate document processing workflows, DocuSign may need to expand beyond traditional e-signature services to comprehensive AI-powered document management to maintain competitive positioning. The upcoming earnings report will be critical for demonstrating the financial viability of these strategic investments amid market skepticism about AI returns in enterprise software.

### Article 2: Uh-oh, accounting concerns circle the AI boom

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://siliconangle.com/2025/11/28/uh-oh-accounting-concerns-circle-ai-boom/)

## Summary

DocuSign is scheduled to report earnings on December 4 as part of a post-Thanksgiving earnings cycle that includes other enterprise software companies like Salesforce, UiPath, and CrowdStrike. The earnings report comes amid broader market concerns about AI investment returns and varying performance among enterprise technology providers, with the results expected to provide insight into the sustainability of AI-driven growth in the enterprise software sector.

### Article 3: New scam sends fake Microsoft 365 login pages

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.foxnews.com/tech/new-scam-sends-fake-microsoft-365-login-pages)

## Summary

This article discusses a phishing campaign called Quantum Route Redirect (QRR) that uses fake DocuSign requests among other lures to steal Microsoft 365 credentials, but contains no news, developments, or information specifically about DocuSign as a company or vendor in the IDP industry.



---

### Article 4: Google security experts say Gainsight hacks may have left hundreds of companies affected

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.techradar.com/pro/security/google-security-experts-say-gainsight-hacks-may-have-left-hundreds-of-companies-affected)

## Summary

DocuSign was identified by cybercriminal group Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters as one of ten companies potentially affected by the Gainsight security breach, which may have compromised over 200 Salesforce instances through stolen OAuth tokens from the August 2025 Salesloft attack. While DocuSign has not confirmed the breach, the incident highlights the security risks associated with third-party integrations in the enterprise software ecosystem, particularly for companies that rely on Salesforce connectivity for their document processing and customer relationship management workflows.



---

### Article 5: Google says hackers stole data from 200 companies following Gainsight breach | TechCrunch

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://techcrunch.com/2025/11/21/google-says-hackers-stole-data-from-200-companies-following-gainsight-breach/)

## Summary

DocuSign avoided data compromise in a supply chain attack that affected over 200 companies through Gainsight's Salesforce integration, according to Chief Information Security Officer Michael Adams. Despite finding no evidence of data breach after comprehensive log analysis, DocuSign terminated all Gainsight integrations and contained related data flows as precautionary measures. The incident, claimed by the Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters hacking group, highlights the security risks associated with third-party SaaS integrations and demonstrates DocuSign's proactive security response capabilities in protecting customer data.

## Executive Insights

**Michael Adams, Chief Information Security Officer at DocuSign**

> "following a comprehensive log analysis and internal investigation, we have no indication of Docusign data compromise at this time"

*Context: Response to claims that DocuSign was compromised in the Gainsight-Salesforce supply chain attack*

*Significance: Demonstrates DocuSign's security response capabilities and transparency in addressing potential threats*

**Michael Adams, Chief Information Security Officer at DocuSign**

> "out of an abundance of caution, we have taken a number of measures including terminating all Gainsight integrations and containing related data flows"

*Context: Precautionary security measures taken despite finding no evidence of compromise*

*Significance: Shows proactive security posture and willingness to disrupt operations to maintain security*

### Article 8: Elastic wins 2025 Microsoft SDC Latin America Partner of the Year

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.elastic.co/blog/elastic-wins-2025-microsoft-latam-partner-of-the-year)

## Summary

DocuSign was highlighted as a customer success story in Elastic's announcement of winning Microsoft's 2025 SDC Latin America Partner of the Year award. According to Hiral Shah, Director of Product at DocuSign, the company leverages partnerships with Microsoft Azure AI and Elastic's search platform to deliver generative AI capabilities to customers worldwide. This positioning demonstrates DocuSign's strategy of integrating external AI and search technologies rather than developing proprietary solutions, enabling the company to provide enhanced document processing capabilities through established cloud and AI platforms.

## Executive Insights

**Hiral Shah, Director of Product, DocuSign**

> "We can deliver powerful AI capabilities from our partnerships with Microsoft Azure AI with Elastic's robust search functionalities."

*Context: Discussing DocuSign's use of Elastic and Microsoft Azure AI integration*

*Significance: Indicates DocuSign's strategy of leveraging external AI partnerships rather than developing proprietary AI technology*
